descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This is the second quarter of the Beginning German sequence: a systematic introduction to basic German. All four language skills - speaking, listening comprehension, reading and writing- are stressed to insure that students acquire a basic command of German. Classes are conducted in German, except when explanations of grammar or other material require the use of English. Key features of this quarter: 1) Writing assignments, 2) Mystery Guest Interview and 3) Selected readings by Goethe and Heine.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Completion of German 101-1 is the pre-requisite for this course or permission based upon the German placement test. Graduate students should request a permission number.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Students will continue to expand their active vocabulary in German, improve their understanding of grammatical concepts and further their oral and aural comprehension skills. Students will be able to interview a guest in German and write a biographical essay by the end of the quarter.
